unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Coffee Shop Sales: Did Advertising Help?
question_text: A local coffee shop decided to start advertising on the radio. The $12\text{ weeks}$ following a lengthy advertising campaign showed sales averaging $\$5{,}785.34$ per week with a standard deviation of $\$385.23$ . This compares to an average of $\$5{,}355$ per week in sales before the advertising campaign. Assuming conditions are met, does this data give convincing evidence that the advertising campaign helped?

choices.text: No, not at any common alpha levels.
Yes, but at the alpha 10 % 10 % level only.
Yes, but at the alpha 5 % 5 % and 10 % 10 % levels only.
Yes, at the alpha 1 % 1 % , 5 % 5 % , and 10 % 10 % levels.
Yes, at the alpha = 1 % 1 % level, but not 5 % 5 % level.
